Pre-Game Insights: Team India will be meeting the formidable Proteas in a clash of the titans.
South Africa and India will be going claws and fangs at each other’s throat, hoping to secure the group ace.
India started the competition with a thrilling win against Pakistan and backed it up with a clinical all-round display that laid waste to Netherlands.
Virat Kohli has been pulling the strings of destruction again at Sydney alongside an on-song Suryakumar Yadav.
South Africa have been a formidable batting unit with a scoring rate in the tournament ranging at a staggering 11+.
The Indian batting has seemed in fine shape, thanks to their top gun mavericks who have led by example.
The Indian bowlers have proved time and time again that they can be the game-changer.
South Africa’s bowling unit boasts of tantamount brilliance, featuring the prized quartet of Anrich Nortje, Kagiso Rabada, Lungi Ngidi, and Wayne Parnell.
The Optus Stadium hasn’t played host to many T20Is so far, with the average score batting first ranging at a modest 142 while the team chasing has so far averaged 141.
Others: Expect some unprecedented pyrotechnics as two of the finest teams in Group 2 take the yard.
Virat Kohli vs Wayne Parnell: Virat has been poetic so far as his brilliance has gunned down the Falcon with extreme prejudice in the tournament opener.
Suryakumar Yadav vs Kagiso Rabada: Another incredible battle to witness in the upcoming contest will be India’s in-form SKY whose 360-degree approach has left the bowlers scratching their heads.

Quinton de Kock vs Bhuvneshwar Kumar: This would be the bloodiest exchange of haymakers as roaring QDK who is South Africa’s highest run scorer in the ongoing tournament with 110 runs will be taking on Bhuvi Kumar.
